intro: Perityle stevensii, commonly known as the Stevens' perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Perityle stevensii is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
